page.title: 04Fords Research Centre,Dunton
page.content: A major employer in South East Essex is the Ford Motor Company. In 1967 the Dunton Research and Engineering Centre was opened. It employs about 3,000 people on a site covering 111 hectares. New models are designed and tested at Dunton. Extensive use is made of computer models for design, and all of the components are given rigorous tests An important current project is development of an engine which gives better fuel economy and does not emit lead fumes into the atmosphere. The European Community is worried about how the environment is affected by petrol fumes and is preparing laws to reduce emission levels. Fords have made a lot of progress and hope to have an efficient engine commercially available in the near future.
